sourcesContent:
import React from 'react'; import './Unit.css'; function Unit({ unit, subUnitList }){ const unitNames = ['Introduction to Data Science and Supervised Learning', 'Unsupervised and Other Types of Learning', 'State-of-the-art Architectures', 'Applications'] const overview = ['Data science is a field that uses statistics, \ mathematics, and computer science to extract knowledge from large \ amounts of data. Since the amount of digital information has grown \ exponentially in the past few years, developing algorithms to find \ patterns in data has become essential for informed decision-making. \ These algorithms learn from the training data and adjust based on \ feedback. The simplest type of learning is supervised learning, \ which is when a model uses a labeled dataset to predict outputs \ given a set of inputs.', 'Unit 1 covered supervised learning, which requires labeled datasets. \ While using labeled datasets is the most reliable way to train a model, \ the most significant limitation on using labeled datasets is that they \ are expensive to hand-label. As a result, the amount of of labeled data \ is much less than the amount of unlabeled data. Another limitation is \ that ample data does not exist for every type of problem. Transfer \ learning is a technique that borrows models trained on large and \ general datasets, while reinforcement learning lets an agent interact \ with an environment and learn based on rewards and penalties.', 'Not every neural network is a simple sequence of layers of neurons. \ Different types of networks have been developed to help models \ of problems.', 'unit4 intro'] return (

Unit {unit} - {unitNames[unit-1]}

{overview[unit - 1]}

    {subUnitList}
); }; export default Unit;
